cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi (550 km) SSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Turning northeast and accelerating; forecast to skirt the North Carolina Outer Banks Monday, then arc east-northeast and move well out into the western Atlantic on Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches not in effect for the mid-Atlantic coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Surf City to Duck, NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastal North Carolina (Surf City through Outer Banks) with swell and rip-current impacts spreading northward along the mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain-band gusts could reach 20–30 mph Monday evening into early Tuesday, but sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤13% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the upper Chesapeake Bay/Baltimore area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain Monday night with totals generally 0.5–1.0 inch; localized heavier showers possible but 4-inch totals are not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Enhanced rip currents and rough near-shore seas along the Maryland Atlantic beaches may disrupt pilot transfer and lightering operations.
